Iambic pentameter /ambk pntmtr/ is a commonly used type of 
metrical line in traditional English poetry and verse drama. The term describes 
the rhythm that the words establish in that line, which is measured in small 
groups of syllables called "feet". ... An iambic foot is an unstressed syllable 
followed by a stressed syllable.
